data.title: Great Atmosphere
data.text: Went here 3x while in town for a wedding. Good food, nice selection of craft beers, and fantastic service. Everyone we met working there were very friendly. My husband and I went for a date night the night before the wedding. Had dinner and enjoyed some live music. Then we went again with a couple of close friends for a drink before the wedding. We enjoyed it so much we brought most of the wedding guests back for an after party. Close down the place. Lol. Great fun!

data.title: Cozy, tasty and terrific!
data.text: We stopped here for dinner on a Sunday night and we were seated on the heated patio. Great outdoor bar and fire pits provided perfect ambience and an electric vibe. Dan, our energetic and polite server, made great suggestions on the menu that did not not disappoint. The goat cheese flatbread, chicken pasta and focaccia, was some on the best food I've tasted in awhile. They have live music and great wines by the glass.

data.title: Public house is awesome!
data.text:
We regularly come here for fries and beer and dinner on occasion esp when we want to take our friends from out of town for great food and show them the best of what Temecula has to offer. 
I love this place! The food is top notch with a seasonal menu that keeps the menu from being stale.  They always seem to have a fresh take on their dishes and I love it! 
There is a great selection of top notch beer  on tap which never disappoints.  The service here is always great! 
I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and a nice atmosphere to just chill and kick back in a cool place in old town. The backyard patio is recommended esp. They also have a front porch dining if you want to be more connected to the Old town street dining experience.  They have indoor seating as well if you just want a more quiet setting.
Note that it gets quite busy on weekends and the wait can be long.  They do not do reservations unfortunately so I suggest get there early if you don't like to wait.

data.title: Waitress Made The Experience
data.text: This is one of the trendy places in downtown area of Temecula. We sat at a table in the outside seating area near the front. It was great weather, the musics was softly playing in the background, and the customers were seemingly enjoying their visit. There was six of us laughing and enjoying our time there. But it was Sarina (Sabrina?) that made our experience so much more enjoyable. She had a friendly, slightly flirtatious personality that played into our conversations well. She made a point to get to know each of us at the table, asking for our names and delivering personalized service. We really enjoyed the Brussels Sprout appetizer and my wife asked for the recipe. Sarina knew it off the top of her head and wrote it down for us. A decision to return next time we are in town is easy to make based on the food and atmosphere. But honestly, we can get that anywhere. It is Sarina that would bring us back for sure.

data.title: Perfect End to a Perfect Day
data.text: My husband and I were visiting my sister in Valencia, CA from Florida. We also were meeting up with two friends we had met on a cruise almost four years ago and they live in Apple Valley. Add one more CA friend and there we were spending a gorgeous sunny day visiting some wineries. At the end of our awesome day we were advised to go into town for some good food. The town itself was charming, inviting, and filled with amazing aromas! We called ahead to the Public House

data.title: Good food and great weekend entertainment
data.text: The food was excellent.  With live music this place is hopping on the weekends.  Be sure to get there early if you want a table.

data.title: Pub Food raised high
data.text:
Service by James was excellent -- just the right amount of attentiveness and knowledge.  This was our second visit, and the ambience was great.  A very hot day, but sitting on the semi-covered patio was delightful with the water misters on the periphery.  
Normally, I would give Public House a higher rating, but the food was just not quite up to 4-star standards.  My serving of pasta (Cacio E Pepe) was huge, but very greasy; I realize the pork belly in the pasta added a lot of grease (and, of course, a lot of flavor), BUT...a lot of fat could have been trimmed from the pork belly to make the dish less greasy.  My husband's Sea Bass was delicious, however.

data.title: Good hang out.  Good food and drinks
data.text: The setting is pleasant.  The food is good.  There is something in the menu for anyone.  The food is better than common bar food.  A good place to hang out with friends.  Great service.

data.title: Great service and great food
data.text: The food was great as was the service. Food came out fast and the menu had a lot of local favorites. Has a great feel to the place.

data.title: Good; but not that good
data.text:
Pro's:
- Good pub grub
- Very good service

Con's:
- Tries to punch above it's weight class.  The menu tries to be creative and clever with traditional pub fare and the prices reflect this effort but the food really is nothing to phone home about.  The Kobe burger looks good (my associate had it and seemed satisfied) and is likely good value if it is real Kobe beef but some of the other items were disappointing.  I went away feeling as if it was a bit of a tourist trap and I'm not sure why it is so highly rated.

data.title: Good food
data.text:
Went here today for lunch.  Had the Kobe burger.  It was cooked perfectly as ordered.  The black garlic aolie sauce was delicious.  They make their own potato chips. They were good and salty but a bit too greasy.
My wife had the raspberry apple salad with chicken.  The chicken was very moist. She was disappointed because the raspberry apple was only dressing! They need to change the menu since their were no apples or raspberries.
Great atmosphere and great service. We were there a couple years ago and it is still good!

data.title: Beautiful gastropub - incredible food and great service
data.text:
We came here as a result of Tripadvisor recommendations and were so glad we did. The outdoor dining area is beautful - spray mist and a moveable roof to provide shade but also light was fantastic. Great ambience, music and seating with lovely staff.

The menu was great - as ever unlimited refills on drinks are always welcome. Children's menu was great - really popular with the kids and decent portion sizes. The chicken salad was delicious but the Red and Black Kobe Beef Burger was absolutely out of this world. If you are going to eat one burger in America, make it this one.

data.title: Great Food and Drinks
data.text: In the heart of Old Town Temecula, count this place as one of the best restaurants!!  The fish tacos and house fries with garlic, dill, and goat cheese were delicious.  The Reuben sandwich enough for two people and they don't skimp on the drinks.  Great outdoor seating away from the street and servers are all helpful.  Great place to go!!!

data.title: Good experience, free EV charge
data.text: A friend and I spent a delightful Saturday evening on the front deck at the PUBlic House, sharing a bottle of champagne and eating our way through several very good menu items. Can definitely recommend the goat cheese toast and the avocado cream pasta. Excellent service. And my EV got a free charge in the nearby public parking garage!

data.title: Best restaurant in town
data.text:
We regularly come here for fries and beer and dinner on occasion esp when we want to take our friends from out of town for great food and show them the best of what Temecula has to offer. 
I love this place! The food is top notch with a seasonal menu that keeps the menu from being stale.  They always seem to have a fresh take on their dishes and I love it! 
There is a great selection of top notch beer  on tap which never disappoints.  The service here is always great! 
I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for great food and a nice atmosphere to just chill and kick back in a cool place in old town. The backyard patio is recommended esp. They also have a front porch dining if you want to be more connected to the Old town street dining experience.  They have indoor seating as well if you just want a more quiet setting.
Note that it gets quite busy on weekends and the wait can be long.  They do not do reservations unfortunately so I suggest get there early if you don't like to wait.

data.title: Local Farm to table and fantastic!
data.text: Ordered dill and goat cheese appetizer was tangy and delicious. Fries were crispy on outside and tender soft potato on inside. Hubby had Kobe black and red burger was juicy and delicious. I ordered Honey that's pretty corny salad and added petite New York steak with honey chipotle vinaigrette. Not for the faint of heart. Very spicy. I love spice so it was great. Steak cooked to perfect medium rare. Bittersweet brownie for dessert paired with glass of Clayhouse Adobe Red blend was divine. Sheliahn, Liza and Ashley were very attentive. Love the food and staff and that and menu changes seasonally.

data.title: Check it out people!!
data.text: The food, cocktails and service here are amazing!! My family and I came in on a Friday for lunch and say on the patio! We had the avocado toast, seared ahi and the roasted corn salad,all of which were amazing!! Our server JT was attentive and had remembered us from a previous visit, even our names!! When in Old Town this is one of my favorite places!

data.title: Delish
data.text: Our server was very knowledgeable. We started with the goat cheese toast with honey and a green salad.  It was great.  I had the salmon special and it was lovely.  Another person at the table had the Scallops and we also had the hamburger.  Everyone was very happy with their meal.  Our server offered us dessert and named the choices.  Nothing sounded good.  Maybe they can shake that up a bit.  Overall, very good and I'd return.

data.title: Average food, convenient location for downtown shoppers
data.text: Had the Kobe burger and asked for medium.  It was served medium rare.  My daughter had an unexpected allergic reaction to either the fish or the tarragon infused vegetables and management never offered to bring a different dish.  The one food worth visiting the restaurant is their Public fries.  Don't ask for catsup.  You won't need it.

data.title: Good food, slow service
data.text:
Came here on a Saturday after wine tasting. We didn't have to wait to sit inside, the patio was a little busy. The staff was very friendly. The food was good, we ordered a bunch of  appetizers. The Mac and cheese was amazing. The goat cheese today was good, as well as the brussel sprouts. 
The only thing I did not like was the speed of the food coming out. We were there 45 min. Also, the food was not brought out all at once. My friend had to wait another 10 min to get her chicken dinner. The order was all appetizers and one meal. I was disappointed.
